gurmukhi: pMcwnin GoKn aucir irp Air AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cqur ic`q pihcwn ]575]
transliteration: Panchaanan(i) Ghokhan Ouchar(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Chatur Chitt Paihchaan||575||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Panchanan-Ghoshani” and then adding “Ripu Ari” the names of Tupak are formed.575.

gurmukhi: Syr SbdnI Awid kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib ibcwr ]576]
transliteration: Sher Shabdaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Ht Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Bichaar||576||
translation: Saying firstly the word “Shet shabadni” and then adding “Ripu Ari” at end, the names of Tupak are formed.576.

gurmukhi: miRg Air nwdin Awid kih irp Air bhur bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cInhu pR`igAwvwn ]577]
transliteration: Mrig Ar(i) Naadan(i) Aadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheenoh Praggiaavaan||577||
translation: Saying firstly the words “Mrig-ari-naadini” and then adding “Ripu Ari”, O knowledgeable persons ! the names of Tupak are formed.577.

gurmukhi: psupqwir DnnI aucir irp pd AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn cqur inrDwr ]578]
transliteration: Pasoupadaar(i) Dhananiouchar(i) Rip Pad Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Chatur Nirdhaar||578||
translation: Uttering the words “Pashupataari-dhanani” and then adding “Ripu Ari”, O wise men ! the names of Tupak are formed.578.

gurmukhi: miRgpiqnwdin Awid kih irp Air bhur bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN dInhu pR`igAwvwn ]579]
transliteration: Mrigpat(i)-naadan(i) D(i) Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheenoh Praggiaavaan||579||
translation: Saying firstly “Mrigpati-naadini” and then uttering “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.579.

gurmukhi: psu eysRx nwdin aucir irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur suDwr ]580]
transliteration: Pas(u) Esran Naadan(i) Ouchar(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Chatur Sudhaar||580||
translation: Saying the words “Pashu-ishran-naadini” and then uttering “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.580.

gurmukhi: gjir nwdnI Awid kih irp pd AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN suGr lIjIAhu jwn ]581]
transliteration: Gadar(i) Naadaniaadh Kah(i) Rip Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Soughar Leejeeauh Jaan||581||
translation: Saying firstly “Gajari-naadini” and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.581.

gurmukhi: sauifXr DnnI Awid kih irp Air AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ sujwn ]582]
transliteration: Saudiyar Dhananind(i) Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Samajh Sujaan||582||
translation: Saying firstly the words “Saudiyar-dhanani” and then adding “Ripu Art” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.582.

gurmukhi: dMiqXir nwdin Awid kih irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib ibcwr ]583]
transliteration: Dantiyar(i) Naadan(i) Aadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Bichaar||583||
translation: Saying firstly “Dantyari-naadini” and then uttering “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.583.

gurmukhi: Aink ipXr nwdIn aucir irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwr ]584]
transliteration: Anik Piyar Naadan(i) Ouchar(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||584||
translation: Saying the words “Anik-piyar-naadini” and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.584.

gurmukhi: isMDrwir DnnI aucir irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu sumiq ibcwr ]585]
transliteration: Sindhdaar(i) Dhananiouchar(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Soumat(i) Bichaar||585||
translation: Saying the words “Sindhu-raari-dhanani” and then uttering “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed, which you may comprehend.585.

gurmukhi: mwqMgir nwdin aucir irp Air AMq aucwr ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu suGir sMBwr ]586]
transliteration: Maatanad(i) Naadan(i) Oucdaar(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Soughar(i) Sanbhaar||586||
translation: Saying primarily “Maatangari-naadini” primarily and then uttering “Ripu Ari”, the names of Tupak are formed.586.

gurmukhi: swivjwir DnnI aucir irp pd AMq su BwKu ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn cqur icq rwKu ]587]
transliteration: Saaveedaar(i) Dhananiouchar(i) Rip Pad Ant Su Bhaakh(u)|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Chatur Chit Raakh(u)||587||
translation: Uttering the words “Saavijari-dhanani” and then adding Ripu” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.587.

gurmukhi: gjinAir nwdin Awid kih irp Air AMq bKwn ] nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu miqvwn ]588]
transliteration: Gadniar(i) Naadan(i) Aadh Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Haincheen Lehu Mat(i)vaan||588||
translation: Saying the words “Gaj-niari-naadini” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.588.
